channel.title: The Boredom Thread
channel.description: I am so bored on my Apple Macbook that I use my Internet browser Safari and just surf the Internet and go to sites like ModDB and look at mods that I cannot play now because I still need to get Windows XP for Boot Camp so that I can play some Half-Life 2 mods on Steam. When I get Windows and I put Steam on Windows, then I will no longer be bored. Well, that's my boredom for you. How about your story of boredom? Go ahead and spew out your boredom.

item.title: The Boredom Thread
item.dc:creator: mr.FREEMANZ
item.description:
bob:

On a different note, ID Software is coming out with a new Wolfenstein game. I assume it is a remake of the old Wolfenstein with the Quake 4 graphics engine or the Doom 3 graphics engine. I also cannot wait for the sequel, Mass Effect 2. I’ve seen some released videos on YouTube where the developers talk a little about it and it looks sweet.

How the hell was that supposed to be a response to my “seconded”?

Read full topic

item.title: The Boredom Thread
item.dc:creator: Lamsey
item.description:
bob:

I am now a Windows fanboy looking forward to Windows 7.

That would be just as bad. We don’t give a crap whether you like Macs, PCs or pocket calculators, we just don’t want to hear about it all the time, and especially not when it’s totally irrelevant to the topic at hand.

Read full topic

item.title: The Boredom Thread
item.dc:creator: bob
item.description:
Spooboy:

I was just talking to my buddy and he tells me he never played HL1 because the beginning tram sequence was such a pain in the ass it made him quit. Hahaha fail.

Tell your friend to take a 15-minute break from the HL1 game and then come back to his computer. The tram sequence will be over and the real action of Gordon Freeman will begin.

@ Raminator: Please give me another chance. I will stop being a troll. Instead of banning me, go ahead and lock this thread if you want to. I will not be a troll anymore. I will talk about Windows and PC things only from now on. I promise this or may lightning strike me dead if I break the promise. I am now a Windows fanboy looking forward to Windows 7.

Read full topic

item.description:
Raminator:

Bob is an extremely tiresome troll and I will permanently ban him within the next twenty-four hours unless someone (anyone) can provide me with a good reason not to.

But he’s pretty… OK nvm I don’t have a reason.

bob,

item.title: The Boredom Thread
item.dc:creator: bob
item.description:
Raminator:

Bob is an extremely tiresome troll and I will permanently ban him within the next twenty-four hours unless someone (anyone) can provide me with a good reason not to.

I use a PC too, you know. It just is not powerful enough for Black Mesa because it has an Intel Celeron processor and some Intel Family Graphics Card that is weak. I promise not to challenge PC users anymore. PC’s are awesome and I might just take Jokerine’s advice to buy a gaming laptop. I have my eyes on the Asus gaming laptop. I might just get it so I can play Black Mesa in all of its’ HDR glory. Anyway, PCs are more powerful than Macs. Macs are weaker. There, I said it. It’s true. Now I will go and hang my head in shame for having a Mac

Read full topic

item.title: The Boredom Thread
item.dc:creator: bob
item.description:
eternalness:

crysis is beyond the macbook.

That’s obvious. You have to play Crysis on a NASA supercomputer for the game to be perfect. If I wanted to play Crysis on maximum settings, I would buy the most expensive Alienware desktop computer. Obviously, Crysis is nothing but eye candy. There are better games out there so I won’t waste my time on buying a machine to play Crysis. Oh and by the way, Crysis has that SecureROM crap that keeps the game from being completely deleted off the computer and you have only 3 activations that are allowed and after that the game won’t work so screw you Crytek for ticking people off on Amazon :fffuuu:

EDIT: Bioshock and Mass Effect have the same kind of issues when it comes to SecureROM and a limited number of activations.

Read full topic

item.title: The Boredom Thread
item.dc:creator: bob
item.description:
Level:

You need a macbook pro to do any gaming, bought from apple online with the ‘customized’ hardware.

Yes, this is true if you want to play the latest games that have come out this year and have these games running at the highest graphics settings possible as well as loading speed times. I can play all of Valve’s games decently on my 13-inch aluminum Unibody Macbook laptop. Games like Crysis set to maximum settings on a computer would be territory for the Macbook Pro with the ‘customized’ hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: The Boredom Thread
item.dc:creator: bob
item.description:
Bob Nintendo:

Regular Macbooks suck for gaming, get one of the new Unibody Macbook Pros if you want to game.

Regular Macbooks can’t even run Spore well, I mean goddamn.

Well if the Macbook can’t run Spore, it probably can’t run Crysis at all. Damn, that’s a shame. Anyway, my Macbook can handle Half Life 2 Episode Two so Black Mesa will be no problem for my Macbook.

Read full topic

item.title: The Boredom Thread
item.dc:creator: bob
item.description:
Level:

Joke computer.

XPS are pretty good, not the best, but they can play most games, just not the newest ones. Just make sure you get the better video card in it. Alienware are overpriced and not worth it. They are desktop replacements, and not portable in the slightest. The XPS brand (I have the 1530) are small ish, portable, and you can game decently on them.

Thanks for the info, Level. I have another question. Does anyone know if there is a way to get older games that are not compatible with Windows XP to work? My old HP laptop had a Program Compatibility Wizard on it that made older games work. I don’t have that on the Windows XP SP2 CD I received from Amazon so it must have just been a Hewlett Packard thing. Is there software out there that I can get that will make older games that do not run on XP to suddenly work?

EDIT: Nevermind, I found the Program Compatibility Wizard on Windows XP on my Macbook.

Read full topic
